page.title: 15THE PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: In{Fenwick}there is a private house that used to be the{Plough Inn.}It was built in 1846. At the side you can still see the stables and dray room where the cart and horses, that fetched the beer, were kept. Nowadays there is a new pub, the{Baxter Arms which is a converted farm house. It is very popular with people from all over the region. The{Star Inn}in Moss has been a public house for over 200 years. The same family have run it all that time. It has kept its old world charm but now has an adventure playground at the back for the children. The local hunt meet there occasionally.
